course.subject: ECON
course.name: Health and Education Economics
course.description: This course aims to explore how economics can be used to understand health and education, and to provide tools and skills to evaluate program and policy in this field. It will start with a review of economic tools to evaluate impacts of programs and policies: micro-econometrics including OLS, IV approach, diff-in-diff estimation, and regression discontinuity design. Rest of the course will focus on recent empirical papers on health and education economics.
course.prerequisites: ECON 2103 OR ECON 2113
